intro: Sphaeralcea grandiflora, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the late afternoon, giving it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Sphaeralcea grandiflora is drought-tolerant and has a compact, bushy growth habit.
